text: breaking news from the High Court just
through to us the High Court has
rejected the challenge mounted by Gina
Miller we can hear vital that Parliament
should be sitting we are therefore
pleased that the judges judges have
given us permission to appeal to the
Supreme Court which we will be doing and
they felt that our case has the merit to
be handed up so we are looking to sit on
in the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania for
the appeal hearing today we stand for
every one we stand for the future
generations and we stand for
representative democracy to give up now
would be a dereliction of our
responsibility we need to protect our
institutions it is not right that they
should be shut down or bullied
especially at this most momentous time
in our history my legal team and I will
not give up the fight for democracy
thank you
[Applause]
thank you everyone businesswoman gina
miller she had mounted that challenge in
the high court to the prorogation or
suspension of parliament there are other
legal actions underway that you may well
be aware of as well similar hearings in
Scotland and also in Northern Ireland
and the case that the High Court was
joined also by the former Tory Prime
Minister John Major they've lost their
case there but they are going back to
they're going now up to the Supreme
Court they've been given leave to take
an appeal to the Supreme Court so the
fight continues for them and that
hearing will happen on the 17th of
September a week on Tuesday
